DataElement.preferredName: Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale Psychological Symptom Subscale Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Calculated numeric value resulting from the average of the frequency, severity and distress associated with 6 prevalent psychological symptoms (worrying, feeling sad, feeling nervous, difficulty sleeping, feeling irritable and difficulty concentrating) used in measuring the effects of psychological symptoms, using the Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale questionnaire.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale Psychological Symptom Subscale Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A patient-rated instrument developed to provide multidimensional information about a diverse group of common symptoms. This 32-question, self-rated questionnaire evaluates the prevalence, characteristics, and distress associated with each of the symptoms._A subscale of the Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale that is the average of the frequency, severity, and distress associated with worrying, feeling sad, feeling nervous, difficulty sleeping, feeling irritable, and difficulty concentrating._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A patient-rated instrument developed to provide multidimensional information about a diverse group of common symptoms. This 32-question, self-rated questionnaire evaluates the prevalence, characteristics, and distress associated with each of the symptoms.

Concepts.definition: A patient-rated instrument developed to provide multidimensional information about a diverse group of common symptoms. This 32-question, self-rated questionnaire evaluates the prevalence, characteristics, and distress associated with each of the symptoms.

Property.preferredDefinition: A subscale of the Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale that is the average of the frequency, severity, and distress associated with worrying, feeling sad, feeling nervous, difficulty sleeping, feeling irritable, and difficulty concentrating.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A subscale of the Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale that is the average of the frequency, severity, and distress associated with worrying, feeling sad, feeling nervous, difficulty sleeping, feeling irritable, and difficulty concentrating.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: MSAS-SF:Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale Short Form.Chang VT, et.al., Cancer. 2000 Sep 1;89(5):1162-71.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale Psychological Symptom Subscale Score
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric score resulting from the average of the frequency associated with 6 prevalent psychological symptoms: worrying, feeling sad, feeling nervous, difficulty sleeping, feeling irritable, and difficulty concentrating.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueDomain.origin: MSAS-SF:Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale Short Form.Chang VT, et.al., Cancer. 2000 Sep 1;89(5):1162-71.

DataElement.origin: MSAS:Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale. Portenoy, RK, et.al. Eur J Cancer. 1994;30A(9):1326-36.
